post.text: "All the progress we've made is at stake in this election. My name may not be on the ballot, but our progress is on the ballot. Tolerance is on the ballot. Democracy is on the ballot. Justice is on the ballot." â€”President Obama: IWillVote.com

comment.author: Jason
comment.text: Haha! A personal insult if Black Americans don't vote for Hillary? Wow!!!! You, Mr. Obama, have insulted our way of life, education, budget, military, Christian values, safety, peace, integrity in the world, and most importantly the vast majority of Americans who voted for you. And, now your standing mighty on the pulpit demanding people vote for Hillary? What have you done to make race relations better? What have you done to give hope and change to the inner cities of Chicago, Detroit, Cleveland, Atlanta and the list goes on and on. What have you done to ensure our vets get the care they deserve or our kids get the education YOU promised. Nothing! I'm insulted at the thought that we should continue down this bridge to nowhere by voting for Hillary! Fool us once shame on you! Fool us twice shame on us! Not gonna happen a 3rd time.

replies.author: Anisha
replies.text: Maybe some people don't want to change it is not up to him some of y'all got to step up and help the kids to and stop being scared

replies.author: Randi
replies.text: This country isn't a christian nation. Never has been and never will be.
